text:
Liga
Real Madrid / Bar√ßa: Sergio Ramos equals Lionel Messi!
Scorer two days ago against Legan√®s (5-0), the Spanish defender scored at least one goal in 16 consecutive Liga seasons like Lionel Messi.
01 Nov 2019, 07:00 by Charlie Creteur



The Barcelonese and the Madrilenians assured the spectacle in this week of the 11th day of Liga. On the blaugrana side, Ernesto Valverde's players were able to count on a great night Messi author of 2 goals and 2 assists against Valladolid (5-1). Side merengue, Zinedine Zidane has relied mainly Karim Benzema author of a goal and 2 assists against Leganes (5-0). During the match, Madrid captain Sergio Ramos scored on a penalty (24th) and entered a bit more history in the Spanish league.




Ramos holds the same record as Messi!




Sergio Ramos against Legan√©s + 11 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

With this achievement, the Spanish international has become the second player to score at least one goal in 16 consecutive seasons. A record he holds with Lionel Messi. Thus, the former resident of Sevilla scored 62 league goals in his career in 468 matches. However, Messi counts 423 in 457 meetings.
